meanings.sent1: He kept overinflating the balloon until it popped.
meanings.sent2: The tire burst because he was overinflating it.
meanings.sent3: She was overinflating her story about catching a fish.
meanings.sent4: His ego was like a balloon, constantly overinflating.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hot air balloon overinflating stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: To cause to appear more important or impressive than is actually the case.
meanings.sent1: The politician was overinflating his achievements to win votes.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement was overinflating the benefits of the product.
meanings.sent3: His claim of being the best singer was clearly overinflating.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like a balloon, always overinflating.
meanings.sent5: The movie trailer was overinflating the excitement of the film.
